  • Server-side metadata synchronization
  • View page source

Server-side metadata synchronizationÂ¶

This does not refer to a completely automated action running on the server, i. e. without opening the corresponding document from the system for editing. Rather, this refers to the purely server-side reading or writing evaluation of explicitly defined document variables. The difference to the usual document variables is that the server-side variables can be used more flexibly. By default, reading server-side document variables are filled by a default handler.

Important

In order for the (by default activated) component methods on_metadata_read and on_metadata_write to be called at all, or their signals officelink_metadata_read and officelink_metadata_write to be sent, there must be the corresponding Active Call values metadata|read and metadata|write for the officelink component

The following code is returned by the example variable from the user manual (cdb.rs.document2cdb_file.cdbf_original_name.N.string.PRIMARY):

from cdb.sig import connect

@connect("officelink_metadata_read")
def set_result_values_in_excel_sheet(self, ctx):
    if ctx.object["cdb_classname"] == "document":
        from cs.documents import Document
        from cs.officelink.documentvariables import DocumentVariable
        doc = Document.ByKeys(ctx.object["cdb_object_id"])
        for var_name in ctx.document_variables:
            var = DocumentVariable(var_name)
            if var.relationship == "document2cdb_file":
                if var.parameter == "PRIMARY":
                    ctx.document_variables[var_name] = doc.PrimaryFiles[0].cdbf_original_name
